title: Online Russian Language Learning Using Technology-Balanced Pedagogy: Integration of Socio-Cultural Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational Russian language knowledge (A0-A1 level). No basic understanding of Russian society/culture required
context.additional_context: Designed for learners from medical, legal, and technical professions, conducted in a project-based learning environment with BYOD. It integrates sociocultural contexts—such as Russia’s healthcare system, legal institutions, and technological advancements—into learning content.

learning_goals: Using 500 basic Russian vocabulary words and core grammar (6-case system, verb conjugations), learners can converse in 10 daily-life scenarios (greetings, shopping, ordering meals) with ≥80% accuracy and pass a 5-minute role-play evaluation reflecting Russian cultural customs.

In graduate academic settings, learners can perform four tasks—10-minute presentations, 500-character summaries, academic discussions, and research paper drafts—using four language skills (listening, speaking, reading, writing), achieve ≥80% in each evaluation criterion (pronunciation, fluency, logic, grammar), and understand Russian academic communication norms.

Possession of project execution capabilities incorporating specialized terminology in medical, legal, and technical fields, as well as reflecting the socio-institutional context of the Russian society in those domains.
Acquiring collaborative language learning experiences through online collaboration tools and strengthening competencies in multicultural team project execution
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
